etymology.description: 老(老) (lǎo, "old") refers to something aged or experienced, while 火锅(火鍋) (huǒguō, "hot pot") is a communal dish where ingredients are cooked at the table in a pot of simmering broth.
etymology.interpretation: The term 老火锅(老火鍋) (lǎo huǒguō) often indicates a traditional or authentic style of the hot pot, deeply rooted in regional culinary practice and offering a taste of time-honored flavors.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃老火锅(我喜歡吃老火鍋)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān chī lǎo huǒ guō.
examples.english: I like eating old hot pot.

examples.chinese: 冬天来了(冬天來了)，老火锅最适合聚餐(老火鍋最適合聚餐)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān láile, lǎo huǒ guō zuì shìhé jùcān.
examples.english: In winter, old hot pot is perfect for gatherings.

examples.chinese: 他们经营着历史悠久的老火锅(他們經營著歷史悠久的老火鍋)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen jīngyíngzhe lìshǐ yōujiǔ de lǎo huǒ guō.
examples.english: They run a time-honored old hot pot restaurant.
